DelegatedInkTrailPresenter.summary: NOTE Experimental The DelegatedInkTrailPresenter interface of the Ink API provides the ability to instruct the OS-level compositor to render ink strokes between pointer event dispatches.

DelegatedInkTrailPresenterPresentationAr.summary: NOTE Experimental The presentationArea read-only property of the interface returns the inside which rendering of ink strokes is confined.

remarks.para: If the preceding method call included a specific presentationArea element definition, then that will be the element returned. Otherwise, the default is returned, which is the containing viewport.
This area is always the client coordinates for the element's border box, so moving the element or scrolling the element requires no recalculation on the developer's part.

DelegatedInkTrailPresenterUpdateInkTrail.summary: NOTE Experimental The updateInkTrailStartPoint() method of the interface indicates which was used as the last rendering point for the current frame, allowing the OS-level compositor to render a delegated ink trail ahead of the next pointer event being dispatched.

DelegatedInkTrailPresenterExpectedImprov.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The expectedImprovement read-only property of the interface returns a value, in milliseconds, indicating the latency improvement that can be expected using this presenter.
